alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 9:34PM AKST until February 16 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST WEDNESDAY FROM CLAM GULCH NORTH... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and freezing drizzle will overspread the western Kenai Peninsula by midnight. The precipitation will quickly changeover to rain for areas south of Clam Gulch as warmer air moves up Cook Inlet. Temperatures from Clam Gulch north are expected to remain at or slightly below freezing through mid-morning Wednesday as warmer air aloft moves overhead. This intrusion of warmer air aloft will allow for snow to quickly transition to freezing rain. Freezing rain is expected to continue through the late morning or early afternoon hours before colder air begins to move back over the region and the precipitation transitions back to snow or a rain/snow mix before ending by mid-afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
